name: Rivendell Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: We have just arrived home from a fabulous 2 nights at Rivendell, and as always everything about our stay was perfect. Kevin, Lyn and Finley could not be more welcoming and friendly. The breakfast as always was amazing, it is by far the best breakfast we have ever had. The choice is great, the service is great and the food is nothing short of delicious! A great family break, in a very welcoming family run place. Rivendell really is a credit to our favourite place in the world....Swanage!!! Thank you x
reviews.title: Best B&B EVER!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: Me and my wife have been to Rivendell following the suggestion of some friends from Swanage and I'm happy to say that it was a great suggestio..delicious breakfast, clean and lovely room and, on top, kidness from Lyn and Kevin
reviews.title: PERFECT STAYING

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just had 4 fabulous nights stay at the Rivendell . Room was 1st class, spotlessly clean, very comfy bed,(slept like a baby), and the breakfast was to die for, especially Kevins smoked salmon and scrambled eggs .There was so much choice even the fussiest eater would be satisfied . Most importantly Kevin and Lyn are TOP people making a great job of running the best guest house that we have stayed in - ever !! Keep up the good work chaps and don't forget to get Findley into boxing it will channel all that energy ! Still can't beleive that my missus could not find something to moan about, (I got a few brownie points), but your guest house is special .The location is just perfect, 2 mins to the station, 5 mins from the town and shops and 5 mins to the beach . We will be back 100% as we loved the area too . Thanks for the memories .
reviews.title: FIRST CLASS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: This was my third stay in Rivendell Guest House, I live in the canaries and my family mainly live in Wareham . Lyn and Kevin are the perfect hosts very friendly and nothing too much trouble. The guest house is clean and tidy and the bathroom/shower are especially so. The locally sourced breakfast is something to savour. There is no parking area I suppose in the days the guest house was built most would have come by train.
reviews.title: Heds 203

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: This review was in my to do list for a few months (last time at Rivendell was on April 2013), but I felt compelled to write it right away after reading a recent one, quite angry and negative . We are entitled to our own opinion, that's my deepest conviction, but it's hard for me to believe that a stay here could have been that regrettable. I visit Swanage a couple of times every year, have family there, and Rivendell is one of my consistent choices. I know many of its rooms. They are all well and tastefully appointed in their limited sizes (remember this is a Guest House), with all the amenities you'd come to expect; mattresses are very comfortable, hosts are kind, warm hearted and responsive, and breakfast is a sensorial experience, best you could get.
reviews.title: Cozy, friendly, comfortable, yummy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This guest house is reasonably priced but up to hotel standards. It's 3 min walk from the beach and town shops, so very convenient, and right on bus routes from railway stations. It was really clean and very up to date decor in the room, nice touches like extra milk and tea sachets put in hallway for room topups, an electric fan, plenty of soap, loo roll, cotton buds etc in bathroom, comfortable bed. But the thing we liked most was the friendly and helpful owners Lyn and Kevin Egan who were attentive and professional but informal at the same time. Can't comment on the food much as we only had continental breakfast which was all fine. Highly recommended anyway.
reviews.title: People people...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayied here as the last night of our walk on the South West Coast Path. From the outside the Rivendell Guest House appears much like any other B&B, but the moment we got inside we began to see how special this place is.
reviews.title: A really excellent B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kevin showed us to our room, ably assisted by his son. Our room was on the first floor looking out onto the street, and was spacious and very comfortable. Breakfast the following morning was absolutely superb.
reviews.title: Last minute stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is difficult to explain quite what it is about Rivendell which makes it so special, but you'll see from the other reviews that many other people feel the same way. For us, what it provided was absolutely top-quality, and yet we didn't feel too out-of-place arriving in walking boots and with rucksacks on our backs.
reviews.title: WOW!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you!
reviews.title: First Class !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I always find it funny that we stay at the Rivendell when we live in Gandalf's Ride, must be just one of the reasons this place is our home away from home!
reviews.title: Our home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Lyn, Kevin and young Officer Finlay are always so welcoming and cannot do more for you. I have visited some magical places and this is no exception, in lovely Swanage. I really do look forward to our visits and cannot wait each time to book up to return (we are already re-booked for next month).
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: We stayed in room 7 this time which is on the top floor and like the other rooms we have stayed in here it was spotless and beautifully decorated. This room has a full size bath for those that like a bath, as well as a shower in the bath. Plenty of hot water after a hard days diving and you are guaranteed a great nights sleep.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013
reviews.text: The breakfasts here are amazing and I hate it when diving is too early to enjoy them. Thankfully this visit we got to enjoy the amazing scrabbled eggs (cooked to perfection) and full English for the boys. The home made muffins, bread and cake are just fantastic and the whole breakfast gets you ready for a hard days diving or sight seeing.
reviews.title: the 5 for excellent isn't high enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideally located right near the steam railway and a short stroll to the beach, pier and main shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Spot on and very hard to fault

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: Shoved in the very small (double?!) attic room. No shower. Didn't have breakfast as would have been an extra £ 10 each..mmm. Not really one for moaning but I feel like it was justified in this instance.
reviews.title: Very pokey and very pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my partner are from Southampton and were visiting Swanage for a friends wedding, And after a bit of research on the net we found this gorgeous b&b. Kevin was lovely, We were greeted and shown to our room on arrival and Lyn who unfortunately, I only spoke to on the phone. Was very friendly and helpful too when booking.
reviews.title: Beautiful one night stay!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: The room we stayed in was room 2, It was beautiful. Couldn't fault it at all and the free tea/coffee facilities were awesome! We enjoyed all the different tea's. The en suite had a nice modern shower and toilet, no bath and the house itself felt very homely and welcoming. Scarily for us there were quite a few objects, pictures, ornaments etc that either our parents had in their houses many years ago or we had in ours!!! So that was nice but very strange :)
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The breakfast was lovely but only continental was available so I can't speak for the cooked. But what was on the menu there were a few nice choices like pancakes and full English. I wish we could have stayed longer and will defiantly be staying again in the future.
reviews.title: The Best Place To Stay In Swanage For All The Famly :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love visiting Dorset and, in particular, Swanage and have had the pleasure of staying at Rivendell twice now - both times we couldn't have asked for more! It is in a great location about 5 minutes walk from the sea front and just up the road from the train station. The rooms are very nice and are obviously well kept and looked after. But our favourite thing about Rivendell has to be, not only the very welcoming and extremely friendly owners, Kevin and Lyn, but the amazing fresh home cooked breakfasts! (I have included a picture of the pancakes, which were great!). The only bad point about the stay would be the occasional outside noise during the night, which of course you would get wherever you stay and it cannot be helped. Would 100% recommend and we will definitely stay here again (possibly even later this year!).
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Swanage

description: Welcome to Rivendell Guest House in Swanage, Dorset, AA 4*Highly Commended and also have an AA breakfast award, with nine bedrooms, all en suite, full English breakfast, guest lounge with open fire. Our relaxed and friendly Family run guest house is perfectly situated on a level position only 5 minutes from the beach, shops and Swanage Steam Railway. We are also within easy reach of the outstanding Isle of Purbeck and Dorset coast where you will find superb diving, walking, cycling, climbing and bird watching opportunities. Over looking the beautiful parish church of St Mary the Virgin. Your hosts Lyn and Kevin offer a friendly and relaxed stay at Rivendell and we are on hand to offer practical help and advice to ensure you enjoy your time in Swanage.
